entry.title: The Sex In My Head (is better than the real thing)
entry.summary:
Author: BugMeBunny

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,025Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Buck has always been someone who loves physical affection, the reassuring feel of someone's weight against his own. It used to be grounding, and comforting.Suddenly, now it is nauseating. It’s overwhelming and every touch makes him retreat into his mind.He’s never been good company to himself.

entry.title: i told the stars about you
entry.summary:
Author: Neuqe

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,067Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 10

Summary: “I guess Eurydice and Orpheus didn’t get their happy ending?”“No,” Buck confirms, with a rueful sigh, “he got her back, but the condition was that he couldn’t look backwards until they got back to earth, but he looked back, and he lost her.”Eddie eases up the pressure on his palm, without even bothering to check how reddish his skin might be, as he inhales sharply.He cannot help but think about the way he doesn’t seem to be able to look away from Buck now that he is back in LA. How his gaze always finds Buck, at work and in their home. It’s an instinct.***or, Buck has been thinking a lot about home and belonging

entry.title: Where The Lavender Grows Wild
entry.summary:
Author: rose_quartz_queen

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 49,981Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 73

Summary: "From his vantage point on the museum steps, Buck can see Eddie for a little longer than Eddie can see him, and he watches as Eddie scans the crowd. Buck’s heart flutters in his chest, feeling like it's going to explode. He can still go home, he thinks, he can still leave. If he turns around right now, Buck can go home before Eddie even knows he was there. He can pack up his locker at work and leave, just like he did in Pennsylvania and South America. "After a not-quite-unexpected kiss, Buck and Eddie finally begin their journey as more than friends. However, as the pair get to know each other in a new way, Buck must finally come to terms with and heal from the past he has worked so hard to bury.A slow-burn fic exploring what it means to fall in love and find happiness after trauma.

entry.title: I Didn’t Mean to Be Something I’m Not Supposed To, but I Am. I Am.
entry.summary:
Author: schrijverr

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 90,739Chapters: 22/23Kudos: 466

Summary: After everything Buck and Eddie have gone through together, the marriage that was once just convenience is now real. They’re boyfriend-husbands, trying to figure out what their life looks like now that they’re dating and learning to be an actual couple.However, trouble arises with the promised trip back home to El Paso for the summer. Eddie is not ready to come out to his parents and Buck supports him in that. Still, El Paso is not the place where either of them have been their best and tensions arise between them when having to exist in the influence sphere of the Diaz parents. Everything that has happened between them catches up as personal histories, insecurities and unresolved issues float back up to the surface. AKA: The terrible, horrible, no good, very bad El Paso trip where Buck and Eddie's marriage of convenience has become a secret relationship instead.

entry.title: When The Past Comes Knocking
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,158Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 80

Summary: After three years of almost-but-not-quite, Buck and Eddie finally admit they’re in love.Then Abby — Buck’s first love — returns to LA, working alongside Maddie and slowly reinserting herself into the 118 family.Eddie’s insecurities spiral, jealousy flares, and heartbreak looms. Buck is clueless. The 118 is supportive. And somewhere in the chaos, Eddie has to learn that he is more than enough — and that love isn’t a competition.

Author: carpediaz

entry.title: Family Game Night
entry.summary:
Author: MaddieBuckleyFan

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,331Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: It is the 118's monthly family game night. Normally all the couples pair together leaving Josh and Ravi to pair up. However this time Maddie decides that her and Buck will team up throwing of the pairings. Eddie isn't impressed when he is left having to pair up with Josh.By the end of family game night all of them decide that Maddie and Buck are never allowed to team up again, realising why Chim and Eddie had created that rule in the first place.

entry.title: Hall Pass to Your Heart
entry.summary:
Author: 79KJ01

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,218Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 75

Summary: At 118 Elementary, Buck is the passionate science teacher who lights up every room, and Eddie is the steady, quietly intense PE coach who never lets anyone get too close.They’re colleagues, friends, and maybe—just maybe—on the verge of something more.Between staff meetings, shared coffee, and the soft chaos of school life, they find themselves learning a new kind of lesson: how to let someone in, one vulnerable moment at a time.A slow-burn school AU full of heart, longing, and the kind of love you don’t see coming until it’s already yours.

  • Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

entry.title: On My Knees, I’m Home
entry.summary:
Author: DamnSterek

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 185,374Chapters: 32/?Kudos: 500

Summary: Eddie’s been in love with Buck for years—but he’s good at hiding things, burying feelings, and pretending everything’s fine. Until one night, he just... can’t anymore. He blurts out that he wants to scene with Buck, and to his surprise, Buck says yes. What starts as one scene quickly spirals into something deeper, something neither of them are quite ready to admit out loud. Cue: seven years of pining, mutual idiocy, soft dom!Buck, emotionally constipated!Eddie, a whole lot of feelings, some very intense aftercare, and eventually realizing that sometimes, love sounds a lot like “Color?” and “Green.”

entry.title: Don't Put It All On Me
entry.summary:
Author: maddies118

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,998Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 8

Summary: By the look in your eyeI can tell that you're no longer sleepingBut we're still dreamingDon't put it all on meBy the end of the dayIt's clear that we're both never leavingBut if we're still breathingDon't put it all on meorEddie moves back from Texas and in with Buck. Maddie convinces him to pick up some shifts in dispatch to get some space and perspective on the changes in his life. A gay awakening ensues, just in time for a disaster that could risk everything. Angst. Angst angst angst. I promise you a happy ending and some fun chat scenes along the way, but it comes at a price and the price is trauma.This fic starts up shortly after where Season 8 ended, timeline wise. Assume canon compliance through that point, though some things will be glossed over (looking at you, Thomas Kinard). Title is from the song by Noah Cyrus and The Fleet Foxes.
